lines.text: declare long integers n and p
let s , f and t be long integer arrays with size p + 1
lines.code: long int s [ p + 1 ] , f [ p + 1 ] , t [ p + 1 ] ;

lines.text: for long = 1 to p inclusive read s [ i ] , f [ i ] and t [ i ]
lines.code: for ( long int i = 1 ; i <= p ; ++ i ) cin >> s [ i ] >> f [ i ] >> t [ i ] ;
for ( long int i = 1 ; i <= p ; ++ i )

lines.text: declare long integer variable temp = t [ i ] modulo m
lines.code: long int temp = t [ i ] % m ;

lines.text: print f [ i ] - temp + t [ i ] and " \ n "
lines.code: cout << f [ i ] - temp + t [ i ] << " \n " ;

lines.text: print s [ i ] - f [ i ] + ( 2 * ( n - s [ i ] ) ) + t [ i ] + s [ i ] - temp and " \ n "
lines.code: cout << s [ i ] - f [ i ] + ( 2 * ( n - s [ i ] ) ) + t [ i ] + s [ i ] - temp << " \n " ;

lines.text: go to the start of the loop
if temp is greater than n
declare long integer variable res = ( 2 * n ) - temp
print res - f [ i ] + t [ i ] and " \ n "
lines.code: cout << res - f [ i ] + t [ i ] << " \n " ;

lines.text: skip the rest of the loop
print ( 2 * s [ i ] ) + ( res - s [ i ] ) + f [ i ] - s [ i ] + t [ i ] and " \ n "
go to the start of the loop
print res + f [ i ] + t [ i ] and " \ n "
lines.code: cout << res + f [ i ] + t [ i ] << " \n " ;

lines.text: go to the start of the loop
print res + n + n - f [ i ] + t [ i ] and " \ n "
lines.code: cout << res + n + n - f [ i ] + t [ i ] << " \n " ;

lines.text: print n - temp + n - f [ i ] + t [ i ] and " \ n "
lines.code: cout << n - temp + n - f [ i ] + t [ i ] << " \n " ;

lines.text: print n - temp + n + f [ i ] + t [ i ] and " \ n "
lines.code: cout << n - temp + n + f [ i ] + t [ i ] << " \n " ;

lines.text: skip the rest of the loop
